titleStmt.title: I. LaFayette Gosling to James F. Robinson
CWG7920

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
To the Honorable Governor of the State of Kentucky.
The petition of I. Lafayette Gosling respectfully shows:
That he is an attorney and Counsellor at Law of the Supreme Court of the State of New York, residing in the City of New York.
That your petitioner is desirous of obtaining the appointment as Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, to reside in New York City.
Wherefore your petitioner prays that he maybe appointed Commissioner fo Deeds for the State of Kentucky as aforesaid.

Very respectfully
I. Lafayette Gosling
2930295 Broadway

New York
Comr of Deeds
I. L. Gosling.
City
Appd Apr 1. 1863
